title.narrative: Traffic Angola

description.narrative: Countering Wildlife Trafficking in Angola - State Africa Regional Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes. Includes readjustment and other benefits for veterans, other than indemnities for death or disability.

title.narrative: Strengthening Capacity of the Government of Angola

description.narrative: To contribute to a strengthened national response to address trafficking in persons in Angola with a focus on protection of victims of trafficking. IOM will assist the Angolan government to update its National Action Plan, National Referral Mechanism, and standard operating procedures for the identification of victims. The project will provide assistance to victims of trafficking and will address sustainability through the training of trainers model, follow-up trainings, and the creation of standard operating procedures.
